overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Savior
overall_perception_summary.description: La Roche-Posay positions this balm not as a cosmetic moisturizer, but as a medical intervention for the skin. It feels like a prescription product available without a script—sterile, precise, and purely functional. It plays the role of the Emergency Room in your bathroom cabinet, existing solely to fix, repair, and save damaged skin for the entire family.

foundation.title: The Safe Specialist
foundation.description: The brand derives authority strictly from the Clinical Lab and Dermatologist consensus, rejecting natural mystique for molecular efficacy (Tribioma, B5). Its mission is Micro-Correction—fixing specific pathologies like cracks and chafing rather than general optimization. By offering this 'Healing Ointment' at a drugstore price point, it democratizes access to advanced tissue repair.

identity.title: The Sterile Guardian
identity.description: The distance between brand and user is significant; it acts as a Reliable Expert (The Sage/Caregiver) dictating care protocols rather than a peer. The visual identity is pure Pharma-Code—white, blue, and minimalist—signaling absolute sterility. The tone is grave, professional, and respectful, utilizing the vocabulary of a medical diagnosis.

communication.title: Functional Problem-Solving
communication.description: The messaging is a direct prescription, hooking the user with specific problems (cracked, chafed) and solving them with rational data ('Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists'). The USP is The Specialist—owning the 'Healing' claim for damaged skin. The focus is entirely on Science Education, using diagrams and ingredient breakdowns to prove efficacy.

benefits.title: Biological Restoration
benefits.description: Functionally, this is a Repair mechanic designed to restore the skin's biological barrier, not just hydrate. The emotional payoff is Relief and Safety—the absence of pain and the assurance of tolerance (even for babies). It signals Pragmatism to the world: 'I don't buy hype; I buy what doctors use.'

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is a blend of 'Thermal Spring Water' (Nature) and high-tech molecules like 'Tribioma' and 'Madecassoside' (Lab), creating a Hybrid Science authority (Source: 3/5 Hybrid). However, the mission is strictly pathological—words like 'Healing Ointment', 'Therapeutic', 'cracked, chapped, chafed' indicate the goal is fixing damage, not enhancing aesthetics (Mission: 1/5 Pathology Cure). Clinical hybrid authority + damage repair = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: Healing Ointment... Soothing Therapeutic Multi Purpose Cream... cracked, chapped, chafed skin... Tribioxin Innovation... Thermal Spring Water

marker_2.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Approachable (Easy to find, easy to buy)
marker_2.reasoning: The scope is hyper-focused on fixing specific issues—'diaper rash', 'skin irritation', 'dry rough skin'—rather than changing the world or lifestyle optimization (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). Yet, at $18.99 for a specialized healing balm available on Amazon, it is accessible to the mass market (Access: 4/5 Approachable). High-spec medical correction + easy access = The Democratizers, bringing dermatology to the grocery aisle.
marker_2.evidence: $18.99... Helps treat and prevent diaper rash... relieve minor skin irritation... Suitable for adults, children & babies

marker_3.reasoning: The brand prioritizes safety above all else, evidenced by claims like 'Baby Safe', 'Fragrance Free', and 'Suitable for patients undergoing chemotherapy' (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is handled through clinical evidence and icons—'Dermatologist tested', 'Allergy tested', 'Recycling symbol'—providing data to reassure rather than mystify (Transparency: 2/5 Evidence-First). Extreme safety focus + clinical evidence = Safety First.
marker_3.evidence: Baby Safe... Fragrance Free... Suitable for patients undergoing chemotherapy... Dermatologist tested... Allergy tested

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is aggressively sterile—white tubes, blue text, grid layouts, and 'Scientific and clinical' descriptions (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The price point of $18.99 for 40ml places it in the Masstige tier—expensive for a lotion, but standard for a 'medical' treatment (Value: 3/5 Masstige). Clinical uniform + accessible premium price = The Medical Authority.
marker_4.evidence: Scientific and clinical... White tube against white backdrop... $18.99... Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists worldwide

marker_5.reasoning: The emotional temperature is cool and professional; there are no exclamation points or slang, just 'Relieves', 'Protects', 'Soothes' (Thermostat: 2/5 Distant). The power dynamic is top-down authority, leveraging the weight of '100,000 dermatologists' and strict instructions like 'Do not use on broken skin' (Power Dynamic: 5/5 The Deity). Cold professionalism + massive authority = The Reliable Expert.
marker_5.evidence: Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists worldwide... Consult a medical professional... Do not use on broken skin... Relieves, soothes, and protects

marker_6.reasoning: The brand is primarily The Caregiver (60%) because its core existence is to 'Heal', 'Soothe', and be 'Baby Safe'—it nurtures the vulnerable (babies, chemo patients). It supports this with The Sage (30%) via 'Tribioxin Innovation' and ingredient education. The 'Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists' claim adds a layer of The Ruler (10%). Dominant Caregiver (Group A) = The Stabilizers, offering order and safety for chaotic skin.
marker_6.evidence: Healing Ointment... Baby Safe... Suitable for patients undergoing chemotherapy... Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists

marker_7.reasoning: Warmth Score: 1.0 (Low). Energy Score: 1.5 (Low). The tone is absolutely clinical. 'Dimethicone Skin Protectant', 'Tribioxin Innovation', and 'Therapeutic' are academic terms (Formality: 1/5). There is zero humor or hype; the energy is purely informational and warning-based: 'In case of swallowing, get medical help' (Enthusiasm: 1/5). This is the voice of a doctor writing a prescription.
marker_7.evidence: Dimethicone Skin Protectant... Tribioxin Innovation... In case of swallowing, get medical help... Soothing Therapeutic Multi Purpose Cream

marker_8.reasoning: The visual temperature is freezing—stark white backgrounds, cool blue accents, and black text (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is rigid and structured, using grids, icons, and clear hierarchies to convey information without any artistic expression or chaos (Entropy: 1/5 Swiss Grid). White/Blue palette + rigid grid = Pharma-Code, signaling medical safety.
marker_8.evidence: White tube against white backdrop... Blue and black text... Minimalist label design... Clean, clinical, and straightforward
marker_8.look_and_feel: Scientific, clinical, and minimalist; resembles a prescription product rather than a beauty item.
marker_8.primary_palette: Sterile white background with authoritative black text and clinical blue accents.

marker_9.reasoning: The hook is the ingredient list: 'Dimethicone 1%', 'Vitamin B5', 'Madecassoside', 'Tribioma'. The brand assumes you know what these are (Hook: 1/5 Molecule). The persuasion is built on raw data and status: 'Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists', 'Dermatologist tested'. It doesn't romance the product; it audits it (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data).
marker_9.evidence: Dimethicone 1%... Vitamin B5... Madecassoside... Tribioma... Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists... Dermatologist tested

marker_10.reasoning: The heroes of this story are the '100,000 dermatologists' and the 'Tribioxin Innovation'—faceless experts and abstract science (Protagonist: 1/5 The Nobel). While 'Thermal Spring Water' is mentioned, the visual presentation of molecular structures and 'Prebiotic complex' places the setting firmly in the high-tech lab, not the spring itself (Setting: 1/5 Sterile).
marker_10.evidence: 100,000 dermatologists... Tribioxin Innovation... Prebiotic complex... Molecular structure visuals... Dermatologist insight

marker_11.reasoning: Validation is almost exclusively from the medical board—'Dermatologist tested', 'Allergy tested', 'Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists' (Validator: 1/5 The Board). The proof is presented as clinical checklists and molecular graphics—'Fragrance-free', 'Paraben-free', 'Dimethicone skin protectant' (Proof: 1/5 The Graph). It asks you to trust the experts, not the crowd.
marker_11.evidence: Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists... Dermatologist tested... Allergy tested... Molecular structure hinting at probiotics

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: The brand claims ownership of specific complexes like 'TribioMa' and 'Cicaplast' (Ownership: 3/5 Complex). The scope is extremely specific: it targets 'cracked', 'chapped', 'chafed' skin, 'diaper rash', and patients undergoing 'chemotherapy/radiation'. It is not a general moisturizer; it is a specialized tool for specific conditions (Scope: 5/5 The Condition).
marker_12.evidence: TribioMa... Cicaplast... Cracked, chapped, chafed skin... Diaper rash... Patients undergoing chemotherapy and radiation

marker_13.reasoning: The content focuses on explaining the mechanism of action—panels explaining 'Vitamin B5', 'TribioMa', and 'Madecassoside' with molecular backgrounds (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to prove safety and efficacy through clinical thesis—using doctor icons and 'Tested' claims rather than lifestyle imagery (Intent: 1/5 The Thesis).
marker_13.evidence: Triptych ingredient layout... Vitamin B5... TribioMa... Madecassoside... Dermatologist tested icon... Allergy tested icon

marker_14.reasoning: The mechanism is explicitly about fixing broken skin—'Healing Ointment', 'treat diaper rash', 'relieve cracked skin' (Action: 5/5 The Fixer). The goal is biological health, specifically the microbiome and moisture barrier ('TribioMa', 'restore moisture barrier'), not visual vanity (Outcome: 1/5 Biological). It reverses damage to restore health.
marker_14.evidence: Healing Ointment... treat diaper rash... relieve cracked skin... restore the skin's moisture barrier... TribioMa

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: This product addresses high-anxiety states—mothers worried about 'Baby Safe' products, patients in 'Chemotherapy', or people with 'cracked' skin. It offers urgent Relief from panic/pain (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is Safety/Sanctuary—feeling safe in your skin again, knowing the product is 'Hypoallergenic' and 'Fragrance Free' (Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary).
marker_15.evidence: Baby Safe... Patients undergoing chemotherapy... Healing Ointment... Relieve dry skin irritations... Fragrance Free

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: This is a purchase driven by pure utility—it is a 'Multi Purpose Cream' and 'Healing Ointment' bought to fix a problem, not to signal identity (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). With 19,000+ reviews and a #2 rank, it is The Standard choice for this problem, not a niche discovery (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard). Buying LRP Cicaplast signals: 'I am rational and I want this fixed now.'
marker_16.evidence: Multi Purpose Cream... Healing Ointment... #2 in Body Creams... 19,428 ratings... $18.99

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Acceptance (I want to be accepted by the group)
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is safety in numbers and authority. You buy what '100,000 dermatologists' recommend and what 19,000 people have rated highly to ensure you are making the 'correct' safe choice (Social Vector: 2/5 Acceptance). It places you firmly in The Majority—the mass market of people who trust French pharmacy brands (Group Dynamic: 1/5 Majority).
marker_17.evidence: Recommended by 100,000 dermatologists... 19,428 global ratings... #1 Dermatologist Insight
